multi easy deployments for high

and see what is happening for their

our first step towards this was a couple
of years ago in 2016 where we launched
enhanced monitoring the focus with
enhanced vulturing was more on OS
centric counters than database centric
counters one of the major advantages
with enhanced monitoring was we did one
second Grand Ronde with this one of the
key challenges with enhanced monitoring
is that even though you get always
related counters you cannot curl it that
with what's happening with the database
for example the CPU might be
hundred-person for a couple of minutes
but it's tough to understand what secret

with performance insights we are
exposing database level metrics - and an
easy way to identify what factor is
causing the bottleneck RDS performance
insights monitors your RDS database
instance load so that you can analyze
and troubleshoot your database
performance introducing performance
insights
this is database centric it's a

the dashboard you can adjust the time

but you can zoom down in the first

second for you you can zoom out to

the interface is for both bigness and

troubleshooting a performance problem or
an issue so the big question what is a
database node
all the database engines have a
structure which tell us who is connected
to the database and water the connection
to a database and for each of those
connection it will tell us which one is
active and which one is idle what we do
in performance inside is we look at that
structure once a second and we are just
reading from the memory which makes this
very efficient and lightweight on some
forecast shows that the impact of
turning on performance insights is 1% of
one the CPU and this is absolutely
lightweight and scalable we look at the
structure and ignore the idle connection
and collect the data from the active
connection so if the connection is
active we will get info like what
Siculus running who is the user what
state are they in whether they are
awaiting state or their running state
what who's the sequel is being sent from
etc we expose this as a metric called
average active sessions or a AAS which
is really a measurement of concurrency
of the load on the database or how many
users are currently active in the
database
